children.value: The Image Category is being defined for loaders.gl v2.0 and is currently experimental and unstable.
The image category documents a common data format, options, conventions and utilities for loader and writers for images that follow loaders.gl conventions.
and of course all the loaders in the
Apart from providing a set of image loaders that integrate with loaders.gl, there are a number of capabilities that are provided for
Worka under both node and browser.
Transparently uses ImageBitmap on supporting browsers
Image category support is bundled in the
Individual loaders for specific image formats can be imported for
However since each image loader is quite small (in terms of code size and bundle size impact), most applications will just install all image loaders in one go:

The loaded image representation can vary somewhat based on your environment. For performance, image loaders use native image loading functionality in browsers. Browsers can load into two types of image classes (
) and on Node.js images are represented using
. The following table summarizes the situation:
A newer class designed for efficient loading of images for use with WebGL
The original HTML class used for image loading into DOM trees. WebGL compatible.
Used to load images under node. Compatible with headless gl.
The image category support some generic options (specified using
), that are applicable to all (or most) image loaders.
Wait for HTMLImages to be fully decoded.
If true, uses worker loaders on supported platforms.
Worker loading is only supported for the
and can be moved back to main thread without copying.ß
There should be no technical limitations to loading images on workers in node, however node workers are not supported yet.

In contrast to other modules, where worker loaders have to be separately installed, since image workers are small and worker loading is only available on some browsers, the image loaders dynamically determines if worker loading is available.
Use
to disable worker loading of images on all platforms.
The image category also provides a few utilities:
Detecting ("sniffing") mime type and size of image files before parsing them
Getting image data (arrays of pixels) from an image without knowing which type was loaded (TBA)
